content.title: ASEAN-India Research Training Fellowship
content.beneficiary: Young talented researchers/scientists of ASEAN member countries
content.details: The ASEAN-India Research Training Fellowship (AI-RTF) is a fellowship scheme initiated by the Department of Science & Technology (DST), Government of India. The scheme is launched as an initiative under the ASEAN-India Science & Technology Development Fund (AISTDF) to support young talented researchers/scientists of ASEAN member countries to carry out research at any of the Indian research/academic Institution.
benefits: Full financial assistance including round trip international airfare, visa fees, overseas medical insurance.
A consolidated Fellowship amount of Indian Rupees (INR) 60,000/- per month.
One-time grant of INR 40,000/- as research contingency expenses.
Institutional overhead charges @ INR 2,500/- per month.
eligibility: Indian nationals are not eligible for the Fellowship.
Applicant must be holding the nationality of any of the ASEAN Member Countries.
Applicant should possess at least a Master’s Degree in any Natural Sciences or an equivalent degree in Technology/Engineering/Medicine/allied disciplines.
Applicant should be working/studying and/or affiliated with any national R&D or academic institution in his/her home ASEAN Member Country.
The application should be endorsed by the Head of his/her institution.
The upper age limit for the applicant is 45 years as of the date of submission of the application.
The applicant should be fluent in the English language.
ASEAN applicants who have availed of any fellowship scheme of the Government of India during the last 3 years are not eligible to apply.
content.application_process: Online application process through the ASEAN online portal.
documents_required: Copy of relevant pages of valid Passport
A copy of the endorsement letter from the present employer
A copy of the acceptance letter from any Indian scientist/institution for hosting the applicant.

faqs.question: What is the 'ASEAN-India Research Training Fellowship' scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is launched as an initiative under the ASEAN-India Science & Technology Development Fund (AISTDF) to support young talented researchers/scientists of ASEAN member countries to carry out research at any of the Indian research/academic Institution.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To promote the mobility of scientists and researchers from the ASEAN-Member Countries to India and provide them the opportunity to work at Indian R&D/academic institutions.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing agency of this scheme?
faqs.answer: Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry (FICCI), New Delhi.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for applying/availing the Fellowship?
faqs.answer: Applicant must be holding the nationality of any of the ASEAN Member Countries and possess at least a Master’s Degree in any Natural Sciences or an equivalent degree.
